page.title: 08NETHER ALDERLEY
page.content: St Marys church is very old.The porch and the nave were built in the fourteenth century.Then the tower was added in the sixteenth century.Finally the chancel was altered in 1855 by the Stanley family who lived at Alderley Park.We have chosen three things which we found particularly interesting: 1. The stone tombs.They are beautifully carved.One of the Lord Stanleys has a dog at his feet and the other is holding a book. 2. Two special Bibles. One is called a "Vinegar Bible" because there is a spelling mistake,it says "vinegar" instead of "vineyard"The other is called a "Breeches"bible. 3.The Stanley Pew. High up above the nave the Stanley family sat away from "the ordinary people"
